page.title: 01NW Edge of Marshwood Vale
page.content: Marshwood, with church and primary school, but no village hall, overlooks the north western edge of the Marshwood vale. This is a lowlying area of fertile clay soil suitable for growing grass which supports the predominantly family farms of the district. The farming is mostly dairying, with some beef & sheep, a small amount of corn and a high area of commercial conifer woods. The settlements consist of scattered farmhouses and cottages. In an area of outstanding natural beauty, there are two pubs near Lamberts Castle, and at Birdsmoorgate, and one combined sub post office/village store/garage at Marshwood. There is virtually no employment other than in agriculture, apart from seasonal small scale accommodationfor holiday makers. A private firm runs the only bus, a once
